title: Summer of Logo
body:
As of yesterday, the logo competition submission window has been closed... on my fingers. I'd like to give a big thanks to the 21 brave men and women who flexed their creative muscle and submitted a logo over the last two weeks. In all, we received 74 submissions, and here they are (in order of submission):

• James - 1
• Maudy - 1, 2
• Ben - 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6
• Aaron - 1, 2, 3, 4
• David - 1, 2
• Whit - 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7, 8, 9
• Matt - 1, 2
• Dave - 1
• Matthew - 1, 2, 3
• Rex - 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7, 8
• Anilisa34bc - 1
• Chuck - 1, 2, 3
• Anne - 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7
• Justin - 1
• TbirdPres - 1, 2, 3
• Mohammad - 1, 2
• Aaron S. - 1, 2, 3, 4, 5
• Bryan - 1, 2
• Anne N. - 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7, 8, 9
• Kompukarl - 1
• Trinity - 1, 2

So, if you haven't gotten a chance to peruse the submissions yet, please take a moment to do so... NOW. Nicole and I will be convening over the next several days to determine whether we want to use one of the 74 logos that were submitted. Our discussion will go a little something like this:

Dan: I like ******'s logo best.
Nic: I like ######'s logo best.
Dan: Yeah, well, you're legally blind.
Nic: No I'm not. You are!
Dan: Huh-uh, dork pie!
Nic: (slaps Dan) Don't you ever take the Dork Pie's name in vain.
Dan: Well, it's obvious that there's only one way to settle this.
Nic: Archery contest!

30 minutes later

Dan: Well, it's obvious that we don't own any bows or arrows.
Nic: Archery contest!
Dan: Were you even listening to me?
Nic: Archery contest!

Another 30 minutes later

Nic: Doesn't Arrested Development come on tonight?
Dan: I don't know.
Nic: Hmm.... archery contest!

Eventually Nicole will realize that an archery contest is completely out of the question and we'll settle on traditional Olympic tickling and best 2 out of 3 in Skip-Bo OR Dr. Mario, after which time I'll report the results back to you. Cool? Cool.

P.S. - Thanks again, logo submitters. You are too cool for school, and don't let anyone tell you otherwise.
author: Dan

comments.author: Fyse
comments.body:
Wow. I'm first. Kinda scary. Where is everyone?

You're not having another vote then? I'm sure we'd all love another of your mighty flash animations. I guess it depends whether you can spare another million hours to work on it...

comments.author: bjork24
comments.body: I don't know if I'll build another flash movie for this one. I don't have quite as much time on my hands as I did last time... but you never know.

comments.author: Chuck
comments.body:
Good luck ya'll...I hope you find the perfect logo! Whether it is something submitted here or just an inspiration from these samples...getting this out of the way will be a relief for you and will help you get moving on that website. ;-)

Best,

Chuck

comments.author: bjork24
comments.body: I am a master Skip-Bo and Dr. Mario player... Nicole will need more than luck to prevail. She'll need some serious MOXIE!

comments.author: Oz
comments.body: Ack.  I feel so guilty for not submitting anything.  I just wasn't in the frame of mind last week....

comments.author: bjork24
comments.body: Oz, don't worry about. You had more important things to think about.

comments.author: Tim
comments.body: Ah, Dan.  Sadly, you lie.  There is no woman cool enough for archery contests and Dr. Mario-thons.  Were there such a lass, I would surely have slogged through several ominous bogs, fought rabid wolverines, and climbed thirty flights of broken glass-strewn stairs on my hands and knees to offer her my undying affection. As that has not yet happened, clearly no such woman walks the Earth.  Good luck with that thar logo-pickin' pally!

comments.author: bjork24
comments.body: Well Tim, I hate to tell you, but Nicole is THAT girl, and she's already been spoken for. Lucky for me, the gentleman for whom she was spoken was out of town the weekend we got married. YES!

comments.author: Gaychel
comments.body: Skip-Bo?! That used to be our game.  Sigh.
